1. City Council

City Council
============

City Council Meetings
---------------------

![Name on Dais](https://www.marshalltexas.net/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=2645)

* Jean Birmingham Council Chambers in City Hall
  401 S Alamo Blvd.

City of Marshall residents have two representatives--
[one from District  1-4; one from District 5-7](https://tx-marshall.civicplus.com/277/City-Council-District-Maps)
--who serve four year terms. Councilmembers are elected on the first Saturday in May in even-numbered years. The City Council selects from its members one Councilmember to serve as Mayor and one to serve as Mayor Pro Tem.

|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| [Risa Jordan-Anderson](https://www.marshalltexas.net/265/Risa-Jordan-Anderson) , District 1   Term expires: 2028 | [Reba Godfrey](https://www.marshalltexas.net/496/Reba-Godfrey) , District 5   Term expires: 2026 |
| [Leo Morris](https://www.marshalltexas.net/266/Leo-Morris) , District 2   Term expires: 2028 | [Amanda Abraham](https://www.marshalltexas.net/467/Amanda-Abraham) , Mayor Pro Tem, District 6   Term expires: 2026 |
| [Dathaniel Campbell](https://www.marshalltexas.net/268/Dathaniel-Campbell) , District 3   Term expires: 2028 | [Micah Fenton,](https://www.marshalltexas.net/466/Micah-Fenton) District 7   Term expires: 2026 |
| [Amy Ware](https://www.marshalltexas.net/269/Amy-Ware) , Mayor, District 4   Term expires: 2028 | |

The City of Marshall operates under a council-manager type of government. All powers of the city rest in the elected City Council who have the following responsibilities:

* Adopt the annual budget
* Appoint the City Attorney, City Manager, City Secretary, and Municipal Court Judge

Residents are invited to attend the City Council meetings in person or
virtually
.

Texas Government Code, Sec. 551.007
requires that a governmental body must allow each member of the public who desires to address the body regarding an item on the agenda the opportunity to do so before or during the body's consideration of the item. The “Citizen Comments” portion of the meeting meets the requirements of this law and is the public’s opportunity to speak on any item on the agenda.

To speak about an item on the City Council agenda:

* Fill out and submit an
  online public comment form
  or
  complete a public comment form
  and submit prior to the time the City Council meeting is scheduled to begin up to the time the Citizen Comments portion has concluded.  Forms are also available at the meeting.
* Allot three (3) minutes to address the City Council unless additional time has been requested by
  [the City Secretary](https://www.marshalltexas.net/166/City-Secretary)
  ..

To speak about an issue or concern not on the City Council agenda:

* Contact
  [one or both of your City Councilmembers](https://www.marshalltexas.net/277/City-Council-District-Maps)
  and/or the appropriate Department Director.
* [Email the City Manager](mailto:citymanager@marshalltexas.net)
  to discuss your concerns.

* [City Council](https://www.marshalltexas.net/220/City-Council)
